note: About the author: Born in Dublin, Ireland, on March 17, 1926, he entered the Society ofJesus in 1942, studied at University College, Dublin (B.A. 1947; M.A. 1948 in mathematical science), at St.Louis University, Missouri (Ph.D. 1952 in geophysics), St. Stanislaus College,

in 1964 for a work on Heisenberg's physical philosophy. H; taught relativistic cosmology at University College, Dublin in 1964-65. He is now Assistant Professor of Philosophy at Fordham University, New York.
title: and at the Faculty of Theology
After spending a year in Germany, he went to the United States of America as a Fulbright Visiting Fellow in modern physics, first at Fordham University
He spent the next two years reading philosophy at the Catholic University of Louvain in Belgium, obtaining his second Ph.D
